title: Day 1230
content:
# Day 1230

We did a thing!

![My Book Has Been Submitted To Amazon For Review](https://miro.medium.com/1*Ya59zjpDwzvUiLBefR1DTg.png)

I also found out how to publish this book without having to make it 72 pages. God bless. I am very happy about that, even though I do think it would've been good to write some more Bitcoin content. The problem is making this Bitcoin coloring book a three-part thing would felt a bit all over the place. To write one book for 3 different audiences makes it complicated to market, confusing to the end reader, and is likely just not the way to go for creating a successful book. Thus, I am grateful that I figured out how to go with the shorter version and release my Bitcoin coloring book that is focused on the 2â€“10 year old demographic since focus is a super-power. (Shout out Saylor for giving me that insight).

Amazon still needs to approve ze book, but once I get that approval the next step will be completing the website which I've already started working on via Replit.

Otherwise it was a great Sunday. Went to church and then to my Grandparents for breakfast. Got back home and crushed a 5k tonight. Also, bought some goodies on Amazon like the [full Twin Peaks series on DVD](https://amzn.to/3IZGC5t), sexy blue light blockers, and a test copy of my coloring book to make sure it turns out okay. I'm very excited to watch Twin Peaks with Paige, I think she will get hooked XD

All in all it was a great Sunday. Looking forward to getting back into the flow of work tomorrow morning. Thank you God for everything. I don't take it for granted that I have the strength to exercise, the brain to understand Bitcoin, and the tenacity to have kids at such a young age. You have blessed me in more ways than I can count and one of the greatest blessings you ever gave me was allowing me to realize how important family is. So many distractions & forces in this world urging people to not prioritize their family or be close to them and I'm glad I didn't stay in Boston. As much as I loved that city and being up there, being back where I grew up, surrounded by my loving family is worth more all the gold in the world. The older I get the more I realize there are a lot of things money can't buy.

Of course there is also a lot of things money can buy that make life better (see the Twin Peaks full collection I just purchased lol) but I know on my death bed I won't be clutching for my Twin Peaks DVD. I will be clutching for my loved ones hands.

My 2 sats.

8/3/25

Conor Jay Chepenik
